post_text: This Friday, at the Falcon Football Game, Connellsville Area School District will be collecting cleaning supplies, toiletries and bottled water to help the Yough School District residents that were affected by flooding. It is now our turn to reciprocate the help that we received back in the August 2016 flooding.

post_text: Connellsville Area School District will be operating on a normal schedule on Tuesday. We have air conditioning in all of our facilities and feel we are capable of conducting a normal school day. As always, we will be monitoring the temperature to ensure the safety and well being of our staff and students and will make decisions appropriately.
text: Connellsville Area School District will be operating on a normal schedule on Tuesday. We have air conditioning in all of our facilities and feel we are capable of conducting a normal school day. As always, we will be monitoring the temperature to ensure the safety and well being of our staff and students and will make decisions appropriately.

shared_text:
Ryan Warner is with Matthew David Dowling.
August 22, 2018 at 4:43 PM ·

LETS GO FALCONS! This Friday, the Coal Bucket game between Connellsville and Uniontown is back and so is the Coal Bucket food challenge! Rep. Mathew Dowling and myself will have a friendly wager on the game but we’re also competing to see who’s fans can supply the largest number of non-perishable food items for a joint food drive sponsored by Fayette County Community Action Agency and Connellsville Area Community Ministries. Food items will be collected at the Uniontown or Connellsville tents by the gates. I hope we see you at the game!

Food items will be collected at the Uniontown or Connellsville tents by the gates. I hope we see you at the game!

post_text: We have had a very difficult two weeks as a school district. Many schools across the country have re-evaluated how we must operate to keep our children safe. We must praise our teachers, administrators and staff for all they have done to make changes to try and ensure our students safety. This is a team effort! Parents, guardians, district personnel, the District Attorney, local law enforcement, the Connellsville Police Department and Pennsylvania State Police have all worked together! Everyone’s efforts have been unifying and heartfelt! We need local elected officials to step up for our PUBLIC school system in Connellsville! This must be a Team Effort! We will be better tomorrow than we were today! We will be better next week because OUR KIDS DESERVE IT! Together we can make a difference!
text: We have had a very difficult two weeks as a school district. Many schools across the country have re-evaluated how we must operate to keep our children safe. We must praise our teachers, administrators and staff for all they have done to make changes to try and ensure our students safety. This is a team effort! Parents, guardians, district personnel, the District Attorney, local law enforcement, the Connellsville Police Department and Pennsylvania State Police have all worked together! Everyone’s efforts have been unifying and heartfelt! We need local elected officials to step up for our PUBLIC school system in Connellsville! This must be a Team Effort! We will be better tomorrow than we were today! We will be better next week because OUR KIDS DESERVE IT! Together we can make a difference!

post_text: Watching "Without a Net" premier at EdSurge Fusion with Kevin Ghost and Phil Martell. 25% of schools across our country do not have internet access in their buildings! So thankful to work in a district that is trying to provide technology and learning opportunities for our students they deserve! If we do not, we will impact the next 40 years of their life! Our kids deserve it! It's not about anything other than giving our children a chance!
text: Watching "Without a Net" premier at EdSurge Fusion with Kevin Ghost and Phil Martell. 25% of schools across our country do not have internet access in their buildings! So thankful to work in a district that is trying to provide technology and learning opportunities for our students they deserve! If we do not, we will impact the next 40 years of their life! Our kids deserve it! It's not about anything other than giving our children a chance!

post_text:
Developing Future and Career Ready students is a must- requirement!

1970 the top three skills required by the Fortune 500 were the three Rs: reading, writing, and arithmetic.

1999 the top three skills in demand were teamwork, problem-solving, and interpersonal skills.

2020 the the top three skills are projected to be complex problem solving, critical thinking, and creativity.
text:
Developing Future and Career Ready students is a must- requirement!

1970 the top three skills required by the Fortune 500 were the three Rs: reading, writing, and arithmetic.

1999 the top three skills in demand were teamwork, problem-solving, and interpersonal skills.

2020 the the top three skills are projected to be complex problem solving, critical thinking, and creativity.

post_text:
Want to wish everyone a safe and relaxing weekend and holiday! Lesson learned this week.....When people have an agenda, it doesn't matter all the good you are trying to do, evil thoughts and actions are evil thoughts and actions....I wish all of our students and their families a safe holiday!! I hope all of our teachers enjoy their families and make memories! All of our administrators relax and gain wisdom that will make an impact! All of our support staff rest after working so hard the month of June! Most of all I wish happiness to all of you who have a positive impact on our children! Working together we can accomplish great things! We will do great things together!!! Happy 4 th of July!
David
text:
Want to wish everyone a safe and relaxing weekend and holiday! Lesson learned this week.....When people have an agenda, it doesn't matter all the good you are trying to do, evil thoughts and actions are evil thoughts and actions....I wish all of our students and their families a safe holiday!! I hope all of our teachers enjoy their families and make memories! All of our administrators relax and gain wisdom that will make an impact! All of our support staff rest after working so hard the month of June! Most of all I wish happiness to all of you who have a positive impact on our children! Working together we can accomplish great things! We will do great things together!!! Happy 4 th of July!
David

post_text: To assist the children that lost everything in the floods this past week in Connellsville, Servpro of Fayette County and Servpro of Somerset County and other surrounding Servpro franchises have teamed up with local churches and individuals to supply free clothing and school supplies. They will be at the Connellsville Senior High School this Thursday September 1st from 10am to 6pm.
text: To assist the children that lost everything in the floods this past week in Connellsville, Servpro of Fayette County and Servpro of Somerset County and other surrounding Servpro franchises have teamed up with local churches and individuals to supply free clothing and school supplies. They will be at the Connellsville Senior High School this Thursday September 1st from 10am to 6pm.
